FestivalPlanner.Util.LanguageHandling

Class LanguageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • FestivalPlanner.Util.LanguageHandling.LanguageHandler

  • public class LanguageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods handling the 'lang' Resource Bundle containing language files.

    The currently supported languages are:

    • English - United States of America
    • Dutch - Kingdom of The Netherlands

    • Method Detail

      • restoreSettings

        private static java.util.Locale restoreSettings()
        Called on application-launch. Sets this.selectedLocale to the language stored in the configuration.xml file.

        If there is no configuration file yet, it defaults to Dutch (nl_NL).

        Returns:
        locale found in the configuration file, or Dutch
        See Also:
        SaveSettingsHandler

      • getAllLocales

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Locale> getAllLocales()
        Returns an ArrayList of all supported Locales.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all supported Locales.
        See Also:
        LanguageHandler

      • getSelectedLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getSelectedLocale()
        Getter for selectedLocale used to get the right language when starting our software, and by the preferenceGUI in the setup() method.

        Since this method is static, we do NOT utilize this.

        Returns:
        selectedLocale

      • getMessages

        public static java.util.ResourceBundle getMessages()
        Getter for messages used by other classes to get strings.

        Since this method is static, we do NOT utilize this.

        Returns:
        messages

      • setMessages

        public static void setMessages(java.util.Locale locale)
        Sets the current Locale to its parameter's value.

        This method does the following in this specific order:

        • Clear the Resource Bundle's cache.
        • Set this.selectedLocale to its parameter's value.
        Parameters:
        locale - value locale should be set to in the .xml file
